The payment transfer is tracked. No further updates will follow from the Status Originator.

errors.name: Account Not Reachable

description.short: Beneficiary account cannot be reached or is inaccessible.
description.detailed: The beneficiary's account exists but cannot be accessed for processing the payment. This may occur when an account is temporarily blocked, suspended, or restricted for certain transaction types. Unlike closed account scenarios, the account structure remains valid but is operationally unreachable.

common_causes: Account restricted for specific transaction types

steps: Contact the beneficiary to verify account status
Request the beneficiary to contact their bank to lift restrictions
Obtain alternative account details if the account remains unreachable
Wait and retry if the issue is temporary
how_to_fix.prevention: Verify account status before initiating payments. Implement account validation checks to detect unreachable accounts early.

errors.name: Account Validation

description.short: Account details require validation or additional verification.
description.detailed: The payment service provider requires additional validation of the account information before processing can continue. This response indicates that while the account structure appears valid, enhanced verification is needed to confirm ownership, status, or compliance requirements before accepting the transaction.

common_causes: First-time transaction to this account requiring verification
Account details do not match expected patterns
Additional KYC or AML verification required

steps: Contact the receiving PSP to understand validation requirements
Verify IBAN and account holder name match exactly
Complete any required account verification procedures
how_to_fix.prevention: Implement comprehensive account validation before payment initiation. Use IBAN validation services and verify account holder names match beneficiary details.

errors.name: Creditor Validation

description.short: Creditor information requires validation or verification.
description.detailed: The creditor's details need additional validation before the payment can be processed. This may involve verifying the creditor's identity, business registration, compliance status, or authority to receive payments. Common in direct debit scenarios or when enhanced due diligence is required.

common_causes: Creditor identifier not registered or verified
Creditor compliance or sanctions screening flagged

steps: Verify creditor identifier is properly registered with scheme
Provide creditor business registration or compliance documentation
Complete creditor verification process with receiving PSP
Ensure mandate or authorization is properly established
how_to_fix.prevention: Register and validate creditor identifiers before initiating collections. Maintain current creditor registration with relevant payment schemes.

errors.name: Modified

description.short: Payment instruction was modified by the receiving PSP.
description.detailed: The receiving payment service provider has accepted the payment but made modifications to certain non-critical fields. The core payment will be processed, but some attributes may differ from the original instruction. This typically involves formatting changes, character set conversions, or adjustments to optional fields while preserving the essential payment details.

common_causes: Character encoding or format adjustments required

steps: Review the modified fields in the response message
Verify core payment details (amount, beneficiary) remain unchanged
Update records to reflect modifications if necessary
No action needed if modifications are acceptable
how_to_fix.prevention: Use standardized formatting that complies with receiving market requirements. Validate message structure against target scheme specifications before submission.

errors.name: Rejected Not Reachable

description.short: Payment rejected because the account cannot be reached.
description.detailed: The payment has been definitively rejected because the beneficiary account is unreachable. Unlike a temporary unreachable status, this indicates a permanent condition preventing payment processing. The account may be closed, permanently suspended, or no longer maintained by the receiving institution.

common_causes: Account migrated to different institution without forwarding
Account number no longer valid in receiving system

steps: Contact beneficiary to obtain current valid account details
Verify if account has been moved to another institution
Update beneficiary records with new account information
Do not retry with same account details
how_to_fix.prevention: Implement periodic account validation to detect closed or migrated accounts. Maintain updated beneficiary account information and validate before each payment.

errors.name: Rejected Validation

description.short: Payment rejected due to failed validation checks.
description.detailed: The payment has been rejected because it failed mandatory validation requirements. This may include compliance failures, sanctions screening hits, insufficient verification documentation, or failure to meet regulatory requirements. The rejection is definitive and the payment will not be processed without addressing the underlying validation issue.

common_causes: Account holder name mismatch with screening databases

steps: Review specific validation failure details from rejection message
Obtain necessary compliance documentation or clearance
Verify beneficiary details against official records
Contact receiving PSP for specific validation requirements
Do not retry until validation issues are resolved
how_to_fix.prevention: Implement comprehensive pre-payment validation including sanctions screening, KYC verification, and regulatory compliance checks. Maintain current and accurate beneficiary information.

errors.name: Rejected No Payment Required

description.short: Payment rejected because no payment is required or expected.
description.detailed: The receiving party has rejected the payment because no payment is needed or expected. This may occur when an invoice has already been paid, the obligation has been cancelled, the amount is disputed, or there is no valid commercial basis for the payment. This is typically used in commercial payment scenarios where the beneficiary actively rejects an incoming payment.

common_causes: Invoice already paid through alternative channel

steps: Contact beneficiary to verify payment status and requirements
Check if payment was already made through another channel
Resolve any commercial disputes before re-attempting payment
Update accounts payable records to prevent duplicate attempts
how_to_fix.prevention: Implement proper payment tracking and reconciliation systems. Verify outstanding obligations before initiating payments. Maintain clear communication with beneficiaries regarding payment expectations.
